result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donnel A. Matlock

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 22R 010784  Bond posted at Sheriff's Dept on 10/17/2022.

No contact with LSH. Defendant to avoid LSH's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by LSH. The defendant avoid contacting LSH or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact LSH. Contact includes: contact at LSH's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. Not to be in the City of Mequon except passage through on I-43 for court purposes.

1:11 PM Defendant Donnel A. Matlock appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Donnel A. Matlock.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD. Counsel waives reading. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $2500 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests $5000 signature bond. Counsel waives time limits and requests preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
